title: Marcus Rashford and Gary Neville team up to make cancer survivor's dream come true
text:
Marcus Rashford and Gary Neville have joined forces to give a Manchester United supporter the trip of a lifetime, with the former defender now helping out with the accommodation.

The fan, known as John, has just beaten stage three cancer and will travel to Old Trafford from the United States to watch his beloved United for the first time.

It is all down to his friend Matt Waymont. Waymont posted a tweet with a picture of John asking for tickets to United's Premier League clash with Brighton on November 11.

Manchester United fan John will embark on his first trip to watch his side at Old Trafford

He wanted to see if enough money could be raised so that his friend could make the trip.

'My legendary USA friend, John, has beaten stage 3 cancer!' the tweet read. 'He’s a lifelong @ManUtd fan but has never been to England or Old Trafford.

'We raised enough ££ to get him to UK but need help getting him to a match! Man U vs Brighton is our aim!'

Marcus Rashford was the first to offer his assistance and has now sorted the tickets out

Gary Neville was asked by Rashford to help with accommodation and he duly obliged

He also tagged in Rashford and other United stars including Jesse Lingard and Paul Pogba.

It didn't take long for Rashford to notice and he has arranged tickets for John and Matt.

But since then, the United striker also asked Neville if he could help provide the pair with accommodation at his Hotel Football complex near Old Trafford. Neville duly responded: 'Sorted.'
description: Marcus Rashford and Gary Neville have joined forces to give a Manchester United fan the trip of a lifetime. John, a stage three cancer survivor, will travel to Manchester next month.
